intro: Inula rhizocephala, commonly known as the common groundsel, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and typical sunflower-like appearance. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and serrated, hairy leaves. Its yellow flower heads consist of numerous small florets, with ray flowers surrounding a central disk. Inula rhizocephala is often found in disturbed soils, meadows, and along roadsides, and it is known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
